msbt.message: I hear eggs have appeared all OVER the island today. It is Bunny Day after all, . You know, Bunny Day eggs are quite fashion forward, what with their bold colors and audacious patterns. They're a fabulous DIY material too. Goodness, I do hope you're scooping them up whenever you can, darling.

If I'm not mistaken, that funny bunny Zipper is hippity hopping about the plaza as we speak. One couldn't miss the telltale sounds of exuberance wafting on the wind if one tried. Anyhoo, I understand he prepared lots of candy eggs and egg recipes for the occasion. He may be anunusual fellowbut he certainly takes his job very seriously, .
I admit, there's something about Bunny Day that puts a bounce in my step. It must be seeing all those eggs dressed up in their most stylish attire, !

Believe you me, darling, I do NOT like to go around spreading rumorsbut you won't believe the rumor I heard! I heard that something strange is happening when you take an island tour with a Nook Miles Ticket I heardthat eggsare coming out of the rocks on those islands. Eggs, darling! From ROCKS! And quite a few of them too, if you can believe it!You know what else I heard? I heard the phenomenon might be happening on other islands too. Perhaps it's happening right here on this very island? You really ought to look into it, .

You know that old saying, "You can catch more flies with honey"?Well, darling, there's an old Bunny Day saying you should also know. It goes, "You can find more eggs by hitting coconut trees."I know, I know. These old sayings can be a bit strange. Still, one should not ignore their wisdom, . Though I admit, I'd rather get eggs from coconut trees than flies from honey any ol' day.

Bunny Day is on this year, is it not? Well, I for one can hardly wait! I love having an excuse to go gallivanting about the island hunting for colorful candy eggs. Of course, I also love having an excuse to EAT all those colorful candy eggs, .

I'm not one for gossip, of course, but have you heard the latest talk about these Bunny Day eggs?Well! There's never a completely reliable way to discern fish from eggs when you only see a shadow But word around the island is that eggs always have medium-sized shadows. You didn't hear it from me!
